author: hwright
msg: Followup to r40135 by removing an unneeded result_pool from a loggy function.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(process_committed_leaf): Update caller.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(accumulate_entry_props): Same.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c
(svn_wc__loggy_delete_lock): Remove the result pool, and use the scratch_pool
to allocate the xml buffer, since it need not live longer than the function.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.h
(svn_wc__loggy_delete_lock): Remove result pool and update docs.

author: hwright
msg: Remove the log_accum parameter from the loggy delete lock function, and
instead just put the item directly into the work queue (making sure to
flush an accumulated items before doing so).
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(process_committed_leaf): Provide a wc_db to loggy_delete_lock(), and
remove the post-call log accum flush.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(accumulate_entry_props): Same.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.c
(svn_wc__loggy_delete_lock): Switch the log accumulator for a wc_db, and
write the item directly to the work queue.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/log.h
(svn_wc__loggy_delete_lock): Switch the log accumulator for a wc_db, and
update docs.

author: hwright
msg: * subversion/include/svn_wc.h:
A test-run downtime experiment to make our doxygen markup much more
intelligent by linking both types as well as error code definitions
from within function documentation.

author: gstein
msg: svn_wc__entries_write_new() is only used by the upgrade process now, since
other entry modifications operate on single nodes (now). Thus, we can make
a lot of simplifying assumptions, and also rebuild the parameters and
dataflow for the specific upgrade case.
* subversion/upgrade/entries.h:
(svn_wc__entries_write_new): renamed to ...
(svn_wc__write_upgraded_entries): ... this. also take the SDB to use,
and the REPOS_ID and WC_ID for the new entries to reference.
* subversion/upgrade/entries.c:
(entries_write_baton): pass along the provided REPOS_ID and WC_ID
(entries_write_new_cb): strip out the REPOS_ID management, fetching of
the WC_ID, all the dav-cache handling, and the removal of all rows
from the three node tables (they start empty).
(svn_wc__entries_write_new): renamed to ...
(svn_wc__write_upgraded_entries): ... this. also take the SDB to use,
and the REPOS_ID and WC_ID for the new entries to reference.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c:
(upgrade_to_wcng): adjust params to db_upgrade_begin() and pass the new
values into svn_wc__write_upgraded_entries
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.h:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc_db.c:
(svn_wc__db_upgrade_being): also return the REPOS_ID and WC_ID of the
newly-created database, rather than dropping them on the floor
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc-queries.sql:
(STMT_DELETE_ALL_WORKING, STMT_DELETE_ALL_BASE, STMT_DELETE_ALL_ACTUAL):
removed these statatements. no longer used.

author: hwright
msg: Throw in a couple more uses of SVN_WC__FLUSH_LOG_ACCUM(), in preparation for
getting rid of the use of a log accumulator.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/update_editor.c
(accumulate_entry_props): Flush the log entries before loggily deleting
a lock.  Add the wc_db param needed to do so.
(close_directory, merge_props, install_added_props):
Add the wc_db parameter to calls to accumulate_entry_props().
